climbs.name: Super Trooper Lookin’ at My Pooper

content.description: Sit down start, way under the northwest side of the boulder, obvious chalked knob and left crimp, if you choose to use the crimp. Demanding move to the two jugs at standing level, then exit left onto the north corner platform and top out.
content.protection: Two pads down and one on the large boulder to your back.
content.location: The Ranger boulder’s obvious little cave.

content.description:
Start sitting in the back of the cave, on a hold that is both crimp, pinch, sloper, and block. Using some trickery and strength, make a big move straight out of the roof to a good side pull. Devising some some more creativity, pull out of the lip and onto the face, making a final desperate move to a huge jug. From the here, the difficulties ease as you head slightly right and pull onto the slab.

While this follows a different path than the guide lists, it is an obvious, direct line. Nice landing and still feels like V7. A good problem to work solo.
content.location: On the southwest face of the Ranger boulder. Look for a small cave with chalked up holds.
